result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony, Requirement for Ignition Interlock Device, Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (5th+ Offense)] and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony, Requirement for Ignition Interlock Device, Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (5th+ Offense)]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony, Requirement for Ignition Interlock Device, Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (5th+ Offense)] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony, Requirement for Ignition Interlock Device, Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (5th+ Offense)] was dismissed by the court.

  • Steven James Dettman was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony, Requirement for Ignition Interlock Device, Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (5th+ Offense)], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Count 2 merged and dismissed.
Defendant to report to Probation by August 13, 2015 by 4:00 p.m.
Court has no objection to Probation being transferred.

  
In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
AODA and follow any recommended treatment.

miscConds.notes:
Inclusive of costs including blood draw.
Apply bond on file.

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

timeConds.notes:
-5 days served will be credited towards the 48 hour manditory time.
-To be served through Electronic Monitoring.
-Defendant is eligible to serve in Washington County.
-If there is a violation of Electronic Monitoring Defendant is to serve time in St. Croix County Jail.
-Court authorizes huber for work.
-Court would like notification that the Monitor has been activated.
-If there is a violation the monitoring company will notify the Jail and the Jail to notify the State.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Michael Edward Nieskes DF ATTY: Joel David Schlitz DF:  Steven James Dettman appeared. Case called at 3:58. ADA Nieskes updates the court. Atty. Schlitz responds. DE currently has 5 days credit and is set up for electronic monitoring.  Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads G to Ct 1 in 14CF446 OWI 5th. DE sworn. Atty. Schlitz believes DE is able to go through with sentencing today. There is no order in the state of MN for electronic monitoring. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. DE acknowledges priors. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1 in 14CF446. On motion of the State, Crt merge and dismisses Ct 2 in 14CF446 and 14TR5532. Court waives PSI. Sentencing arguments. Crt orders: Sentence W/H.
5 days served will be credited towards the 48 hours manditory time.
3 years probation with conditions:
- 6 months St. Croix County jail to be served through electronic monitoring.
- AODA and follow through with any recommended treatment.
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- 30 mo DL revocation
- 30 mo IID
- $2000.00 inclusive of costs and blood draw.
Apply bond on file

DE to sign up for probation by 08-13-2015 by 4:00pm. Court has no objection to probation being transferred. 
DE is eligible to serve monitoring in Washington County. If there is a violation of electronic monitoring DE is to serve time in St. Croix County. Court authorizes huber for work. 
Court would like notification that the monitor has been activitated. If there is a violation the monitoring company will notify the jail and the jail notify the State.
Plea hearing at 08-12-2015 03:00 pm
Plea hearing at 08-12-2015 03:00 pm

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson.ADA:  Michael E. Nieskes   DF ATTY:  Joel David Schlitz   DF:  Steven James Dettman appeared. Case called at 1:12. Court reviews file. Information has been filed. Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  NG to both counts. ADA Nieskes informs the court of a closed case, 14TR5532. Court will reopen 14TR5532 and set to trail.  Waives speedy trial. Court grants 20 days for filing of motions. Bond continues. ADA Nieskes has no objection for DE to appear by phone at PTC if needed.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 2, 2015 at 09:30 am.
